Package com.w10.risk_game.engines

Class TournamentEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.w10.risk_game.engines.TournamentEngine
  • public class TournamentEngine
extends Object
    The TournamentEngine class is responsible for managing and running a series of games on different maps using a set of player strategies.

      private Set<Player> createPlayers​(Set<String> p_playerStrategyNames)

      void displayResult​(List<MatchResult> l_listofMatchResults)
      The function displays the results of a tournament by printing the game count, map, and player name for each match result in a given list.
      protected String playGame​(String p_map, Set<Player> p_players, int p_maxTurns)
      The function "playGame" takes a map, a set of players, and a maximum number of turns as input, and simulates a game by assigning countries to players and allowing each player to take turns until a winner is determined or the maximum number of turns is reached.

      • SetPhase

      • startGame

        public void startGame​(Set<String> p_playerStrategyNames,
                      Set<String> p_maps,
                      int p_gamesCount,
                      int p_maxTurns)
        The startGame function runs a tournament by playing multiple games on different maps with a given set of player strategies, and then displays the results.
        Parameters:
        p_playerStrategyNames - A set of strings representing the names of the player strategies.
        p_maps - A set of strings representing the names of the maps to be used in the game.
        p_gamesCount - The number of games to be played in the tournament.
        p_maxTurns - The parameter `p_maxTurns` represents the maximum number of turns allowed in each game.

      • createPlayers

        private Set<Player> createPlayers​(Set<String> p_playerStrategyNames)
        The function creates a set of players based on a set of player strategy names, assigns the corresponding strategy to each player, and returns the set of players.
        Parameters:
        p_playerStrategyNames - A set of strings representing the names of player strategies.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Set of Player objects.

      • playGame

        protected String playGame​(String p_map,
                          Set<Player> p_players,
                          int p_maxTurns)
        The function "playGame" takes a map, a set of players, and a maximum number of turns as input, and simulates a game by assigning countries to players and allowing each player to take turns until a winner is determined or the maximum number of turns is reached.
        Parameters:
        p_map - The parameter "p_map" is a string that represents the map being used for the game.
        p_players - The parameter "p_players" is a Set of Player objects. It represents the set of players participating in the game.
        p_maxTurns - The maximum number of turns that the game will be played for.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String value. If there is a winner, it will return the name of the winner. If there is no winner after the maximum number of turns, it will return "Draw".

      • displayResult

        public void displayResult​(List<MatchResult> l_listofMatchResults)
        The function displays the results of a tournament by printing the game count, map, and player name for each match result in a given list.
        Parameters:
        l_listofMatchResults - The parameter `l_listofMatchResults` is a List of MatchResult objects.
